episodes.natural_language:
Case Dustin-Meade-MVA-03-09-2025 concerns client Dustin Meade. The initial client contact was made on March 19, 2025 by Justin regarding Dustin Meade’s motor vehicle accident. Dustin Meade’s contact information is: phone 502-230-0975, date of birth February 1, 1987, SSN 742-48-4314, and address 512 Mabel Lane, Scottsburg, IN 47170. The date of the accident is March 9, 2025. Jeffersonville Police Department report number 202510418 accompanies the case, and Progressive Claim number 25-615241502 applies. Dustin reports injuries of lower back pain, right-sided hip pain, and numbness in the right foot. He has no health insurance and there has been no treatment to date.

Jessica Mahaney is also noted in connection with the case. Her contact details are phone 502-230-0975, date of birth October 9, 1983, SSN 457-65-3516. Her reported injuries are lower back pain and left hip pain. Both Dustin Meade and Jessica Mahaney will be treated with Scott Count Chiro. The date and time of the initial contact is March 19, 2025, and the person making contact was Justin.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Dustin-Meade-MVA-03-09-2025
Client: Dustin Meade

In March 2025, the Dustin Meade motor vehicle accident case (MVA) was being handled under the file Dustin-Meade-MVA-03-09-2025. On March 21, 2025, at 09:56:32 GMT-04:00, Aries Penaflor of Whaley Law Firm forwarded an external email thread regarding claim number 25-615241502. The forward was sent from Aries Penaflor (aries@whaleylawfirm.com) to Dustin Meade’s Filevine project email address (DustinMeadeMVAZ4957017@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com). The subject of the forwarded message was “__Fwd: [EXTERNAL] Re: 25-615241502__,” and the email included Aries Penaflor and jessa@whaleylawfirm.com in the CC line.

The forwarded thread includes a message from Alisha Smith, dated March 21, 2025 at 9:22? AM, addressed to Dustin Meade with the subject “RE: [EXTERNAL] Re: 25-615241502.” In that message, Alisha Smith, identified as a Claims Generalist Associate, acknowledged Dustin’s concerns and stated that she had been working on Dustin’s claim as efficiently and diligently as possible. She reported that she had been in contact with Dustin’s attorney as well as Jessica’s attorney to ensure everything is addressed correctly and that she had included them in the email. She also cautioned that she would not allow Dustin to speak to her in the manner in which he had spoken.

The chain shows a reply from Dustin Meade sent on Friday, March 21, 2025 at 1:14 AM to Alisha Smith, under the subject “[EXTERNAL] Re: 25-615241502.” In his message, Dustin wrote, “Are the worst claims adjuster I’ve ever had your callback game is worse than my pull out game and yes recorded it’s terrible.”

Earlier in the thread, Dustin had sent a message on Thursday, March 20, 2025 at 2:19 PM, stating, “Hey Alisha it’s Dustin Meade could you please call me at 502-799-3729.”

The thread also contains a prior message from Alisha Smith dated Wednesday, March 12, 2025 at 9:52 AM. In that message, Alisha identified herself as “Alisha Smith,” a Claims Generalist Associate, and provided her contact details: P.O. Box 94670, Cleveland, OH 44101-9919; Phone: (219) 649-7283; Fax: 833.905.1742; Email: Alisha_Smith@Progressive.com. She listed her availability hours as Monday–Friday, 9:00 AM–6:00 PM EST. She noted the confidential and legally privileged nature of the contents of the email and any attachments, indicating they are intended solely for the addressee, and that if the recipient was not the intended recipient, any use, dissemination, distribution, storage, or copying of the email is strictly prohibited. If the email was received in error, she asked the recipient to notify the sender and to destroy the message and any attachments. She also stated that all correspondence from the recipient may become part of the permanent claims file and that the firm may respond to a reply by email or by telephone. The closing of that message included a signature block with “All the best, Aries Paul Peñaflor” and the Whaley Law Firm contact phone and fax numbers: Ph: (502)365-5788; Fax: (502)364-9363.

In addition to the content, the forwarded email header confirms that the message originated from Aries Penaflor and was sent to Dustin Meade’s Filevine project email address, with the subject referencing the external Re: 25-615241502 thread. The CC line for the Alisha Smith message shows that Aries Penaflor and jessa@whaleylawfirm.com were included. The entire exchange forms part of the ongoing communications regarding claim 25-615241502 in the Dustin Meade MVA case.
episodes.author: Aries

Case: Dustin-Meade-MVA-03-09-2025. Client: Dustin Meade.

On March 26, 2025 at 4:36 PM, Progressive left a new voice message related to Dustin Meade and Jessica Mahaney. The message was received as a RingCentral voicemail, and the forward showing the message was sent on March 27, 2025 at 08:17:27 PM (GMT-04:00) from Jessa Galosmo to Justin Chumbley. The original voicemail was from Progressive Claims, dialing (502) 909-3687, with the caller identified as Katie in the Personal Injury Protection Department who is the PIP adjuster assigned to this file. The voicemail was 33 seconds long and was sent to Jessa Galosmo at the number (502) 357-9975.

The voicemail preview states: “Hi, this is Katie calling from Progressive Claims. I am in the Personal Injury Protection Department and calling about Dustin Mead and Jessica Mahaney. I am the PIP adjuster that will be on this file. We are going to work on getting an email sent over to you all as well, but we did receive a letter from up just had a couple of follow up questions. My phone number is 529093687 claim number is 2 561-524-1502? Thank you.” The message invites listening to the full voicemail via RingCentral by logging in with the main number, extension, and password, and notes that voicemails can also be managed within the RingCentral account.

Client: Dustin Meade

__Fwd: Progressive Claim #25-615241502__
From: Jessa Galosmo [jessa@whaleylawfirm.com](mailto:jessa@whaleylawfirm.com)
To: Justin Chumbley [justin@whaleylawfirm.com](mailto:justin@whaleylawfirm.com)
Date: Thu Mar 27 2025 08:22:40 GMT-04:00

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Katie Mills 
Date: Wed, Mar 26, 2025 at 4:50?PM
Subject: Progressive Claim #25-615241502
To: JESSA@WHALEYLAWFIRM.COM ,
aries@whaleylawfirm.com 

Hello,

You were both listed as contacts in our claim. Please let me know if I
should only reach out to one of you going forward. We received your letter
of representation for Jessica Mahaney and Dustin Meade. I will be handling
the Personal Injury Protection (PIP) claim being presented on behalf of
your client.* Per your letter, $4,000 of benefits have been reserved, and
we will not pay ER/EMS bills at this time. *I have attached our letter of
Acknowledgment. I have also attached a blank PIP Application, dec page, and
policy.

If able, please respond to my initial treatment and injury questions:

1. Have either of your client treated anywhere else in addition to Scott
County Chiro?

2. Did your client lose any wages? If so, please advise where they work,
what their job is, what their pay rate is and how long they may be off
work. (We'll need off work slips and wage documentation from the employer)

Thank you for your time.

*Katie Mills**|**KY Medical Claims Representative*

PO Box 2930 | Clinton, IA 52733

Phone 502-909-3687 | Fax 877-213-7258

Hours: Monday-Friday 8:00 am-5:00 pm EST

Email: Katherine_e_mills@progressive.com

 

The contents of this e-mail and any attachments are confidential and may be
legally privileged, intended solely for the addressee. If you are not the
intended recipient, be advised that any use, dissemination, distribution,
storage (including electronic) or copying of this e-mail is strictly
prohibited. If you receive this e-mail in error, please notify the sender
immediately by reply e-mail and destroy the message and its attachments.

-- 
All the best,
Jessa Galosmo
Whaley Law Firm
Ph: (502)357-9975
Fax: (502)364-9363
episodes.natural_language:
Case: Dustin-Meade-MVA-03-09-2025. Client: Dustin Meade. The file includes a forwarded Progressive Claim #25-615241502. On March 27, 2025, Jessa Galosmo of the Whaley Law Firm forwarded the claim to Justin Chumbley regarding the matter.

The forwarded message originated as an email from Katie Mills, a KY Medical Claims Representative for Progressive, dated Wednesday, March 26, 2025 at 4:50?PM, with the subject “Progressive Claim #25-615241502.” The message was sent to JESSA@WHALEYLAWFIRM.COM and aries@whaleylawfirm.com. Katie explained that both contacts were listed in the claim and asked whether she should reach out to only one going forward. She stated that the claim includes letters of representation for Jessica Mahaney and Dustin Meade and that she would be handling the Personal Injury Protection (PIP) claim on behalf of the clients. Per the letter, $4,000 of benefits have been reserved and Progressive will not pay ER/EMS bills at this time. Katie noted that she had attached a letter of Acknowledgment and also attached a blank PIP Application, a declaration page, and the policy.

Katie also requested responses to two initial treatment and injury questions: (1) whether either client has been treated anywhere else besides Scott County Chiro, and (2) whether the client lost any wages. If wages were lost, she asked for details on where they work, the nature of their job, their pay rate, and how long they may be off work, noting that off-work slips and wage documentation from the employer would be required. She closed by thanking the recipients for their time.

Katie Mills’s contact details were listed as follows: KY Medical Claims Representative, P.O. Box 2930, Clinton, IA 52733; phone 502-909-3687, fax 877-213-7258; hours Monday through Friday, 8:00 am–5:00 pm EST; email Katherine_e_mills@progressive.com.

The email contained a confidentiality notice stating that the contents of the email and any attachments are confidential and may be legally privileged, intended solely for the addressee, and that any use, dissemination, distribution, storage, or copying by non-recipients is strictly prohibited. If received in error, the recipient was instructed to notify the sender by reply email and destroy the message and its attachments. The message concluded with Jessa Galosmo’s sign-off: “All the best, Jessa Galosmo, Whaley Law Firm, Ph: (502)357-9975, Fax: (502)364-9363.”
episodes.author: Jessa
